info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bladen and northeastern Robeson Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Duart, or 13 miles northeast of Lumberton, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tobermory, Smiths, Howellsville, Bladen Community College, Tolarsville, Duart, Dublin and Tar Heel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
